body: $ZIM Correct me if I'm wrong. I went into the last year of dividends for $ZIM and looked at the price on date of dividend announcement tracked the increase to highest amount before ex dividend and tracked how much it fell end of day on ex dividend date.
For March 22 $17 dividend. Good earnings. It climbed $17.32 from announcement to ex. Then dropped $12 EOD ex. 13.6% drop from high.
May 22 $2.85 dividend. Good earnings. It climbed $8.23 then dropped $5.86 EOD ex. 8.4%. drop from high
Aug 22 $4.75 dividend. Bad earnings. It climbed $0.42 then dropped $8.92 EOD ex. 18.5% drop from high.
Nov 22 $2.95 dividend. Bad earnings. It climbed $0.10 then dropped $4.25 EOD ex. 16.6% drop from high.
Current $6.40 dividend. Great earnings. It climbed $4.96 from announcement low $19.57 to best day end of day $24.53. if it has an 18% drop from high on ex dividend. That's roughly $4.50
created_at: which would put the price at $20 on end of ex dividend day
